channel.title: FFXIV Tips, Tricks, & More on Spicy Chicken Quest
channel.description: Recent content in FFXIV Tips, Tricks, & More on Spicy Chicken Quest

item.title: 15: Sastasha
item.description: IF YA WANT A MORE DETAILED GUIDE GO HERE Map of Sastasha Special Loot Sahagin Triple Triad Card Trash part 1 If you do not kill the clams, they will continue to spawn sparks that will annoy your healer, dps, and tank If you want to immediately spawn the first boss, be sure to pick up the bloody memo at the start of the instance to know what color coral to click.

item.title: Everyone
item.description: Limit Break is your friend! You can find the action Limit Break in your “Actions & Traits” window, under “General”. Generally speaking, Limit Break is saved for the last boss for the DPS to use when the boss hits 10% health. This changes as you get further into trials / dungeons / etc. There are unique trials that require the use of LB3 by specific roles in certain circumstances.

item.title: 16: Tam Tara Deepcroft
item.description: Link to detailed guide for dungeon Map of Dungeon Special Loot Nothing fancy. Trash x 3 The are ranged casters in this dungeon, so group up the mobs near the ranged to ensure AoE emnity is maintained! Group up mobs together to allow the very few jobs that have AoE at this level can do so. Void Soulcounter x 3 When a Void Soulcounter shows up, it will cast Enthunder which can be interupted quickly in order to prevent it getting an attack speed buff.

item.title: DPS
item.description: Mechanics are more important than your DPS If you choose to ignore a mechanic, there’s a good chance you will die. Dead DPS do no DPS. Don’t stand in front of the boss It’s a good way to get cleaved or tankbustered and die. Dead DPS do no DPS. If you’re ranged, stay near healer Healers have heals that are mostly centered around themselves (there are exceptions), but this helps them to be able to do top ups quickly from raidwides.

item.title: 17: Copperbell Mines
item.description: Link to detailed guide for dungeon Map of Dungeon map Special Loot Nothing of note Trash part 1 Make sure you pick up the tiny key dropped by mobs! The first 2 spriggans in the dungeon leash back to the beginning if you do not kill them fast and move too far ahead. Kottos Kill adds. Kill adds. Kill adds… yawn… kill adds… Oo boss!

item.title: Healers
item.description: Your job is more than healing Be sure you DPS! For all encounters the developers include healer DPS for mechanics, enrages, etc. Get used to it now. You do not have to keep people at 100% health As long as they enough health to survive the tankbuster or raidwide, they are fine! There is passive healing in combat and massive passive healing out of combat! Plan for your group run Check your party’s gear, you’ll want to know if they are undergeared for the level dungeon/trial/raid you are doing.

item.title: Tanks
item.description: Put on Emnity (threat) Stance Simply having this turned on, you hold threat as long as you hit the targets! DRK: Grit WAR: Defiance GNB: Royal Guard PLD: Iron Will Just because the boss is not physically looking at you does NOT mean you have lost threat There are actions that a boss, or mob will perform that have them physicall turn away from you.

item.title: Visual Guide to Mechanics
item.description: Throughout your gameplay, you will run across various mechanics that repeat in dungeons, trials, and raids. This is an attempt to help you understand what to do if you see them A lot of these mechanics repeat in dungeons, trials, and raids, are are named after some of the first times they show up. Example, Exo Flares was first shown in a fight and was called Exo Flare. So even if a boss uses a different name, the community just recognizes the attack does the exact same thing and will call it that!

item.title: GCD/oGCD
item.description: Global Cooldown (GCD) Share a cast timer with each other. Have the tags of “Weaponskill” or “Spell”. Off Global Cooldown (oGCD) Have a cast of “instant” and can be woven between GCDs.

item.title: Tankbuster
item.description: Tankbuster An attack, or quick series of attacks, that does immense damage. Must be mitigated through! Some tankbusters are shared, either between the Main and Off Tank, or the whole party!

item.title: Feedback
item.description: Feedback If you have any suggestions, feedback, requests, or ideas for this site please head to github and create an issue.

item.title: Contributors
item.description: A massive thank you to everyone who has contributed from screenshots, to tips, to ideas, to guides. I love you. Spicy Chicken: …the one who inspired this entire concept. DBFig: For suggestions on what he wished he knew when starting. Lysias Grant: Cause everyone needs one of him in their life. Spicy Chicken: …the one who inspired this entire concept. Maiq “TheLiar” Grant: Thoughts, tips, and cause everyone needs one in thier life.

item.title: Lvl80
item.description: Level 80 Progress To be effient, have 5 quests running at once to ensure that you get everything all the time from all the things. For Want of a Memory (BSF, HW Fates) The Will to Resist (Antitower) Change of Arms (CT, CLL, CE BSF) A New Path of Resistance (DR) Irresistible (DR, Dalraida, LVL 70 Dungeon, HoH ) Done: Steps Resistance First Free. Each additional one takes 4 Thavnairian Scalepowders (Cost 1000 Poetics)

item.title: Lvl70
item.description: Fabulous Website: https://ffxiv-eureka.com/ Weapon Specific Relic Every Instance of Eureka has it’s own relic step. In each Individual Instance, there will be a map boss which drops the needed item for the relic. You don’t have to farm the map boss for their item! The item from Aenmos, Pagos and Pyros can be bought at The Expedition Birdwatcher found in each zone. Eureka Anemos Item Required Amount Which step?
